   20: 
   21: -module(bif_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   27: 
   28: -export([display/1, display_huge/0, display_string/1,
   29: 	 erl_bif_types/1,guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types/1,
   30: 	 shadow_comments/1,list_to_utf8_atom/1,
   31: 	 specs/1,improper_bif_stubs/1,auto_imports/1,
   32: 	 t_list_to_existing_atom/1,os_env/1,otp_7526/1,
   33: 	 t_binary_to_atom/1,t_binary_to_existing_atom/1,
   34: 	 t_atom_to_binary/1,min_max/1, erlang_halt/1,
   35:          erl_crash_dump_bytes/1,
   36: 	 is_builtin/1, error_stacktrace/1,
   37: 	 error_stacktrace_during_call_trace/1,
   38:          group_leader_prio/1, group_leader_prio_dirty/1,
   39:          is_process_alive/1,
   40:          is_process_alive_signal_from/1,
   41:          process_info_blast/1,
   42:          os_env_case_sensitivity/1,
   43:          verify_middle_queue_save/1,
   44:          test_length/1,
   45:          fixed_apply_badarg/1,
   46:          external_fun_apply3/1]).
   47: 
   48: suite() ->
   49:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   50:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   51: 
   52: all() -> 
   53:     [erl_bif_types, guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types, shadow_comments,
   54:      specs, improper_bif_stubs, auto_imports,
   55:      t_list_to_existing_atom, os_env, otp_7526,
   56:      display, display_string, list_to_utf8_atom,
   57:      t_atom_to_binary, t_binary_to_atom, t_binary_to_existing_atom,
   58:      erl_crash_dump_bytes, min_max, erlang_halt, is_builtin,
   59:      error_stacktrace, error_stacktrace_during_call_trace,
   60:      group_leader_prio, group_leader_prio_dirty,
   61:      is_process_alive, is_process_alive_signal_from,
   62:      process_info_blast, os_env_case_sensitivity,
   63:      verify_middle_queue_save, test_length,fixed_apply_badarg,
   64:      external_fun_apply3].
   65: 
   66: init_per_testcase(guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   67:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   68: init_per_testcase(erl_bif_types, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   69:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   70: init_per_testcase(shadow_comments, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   71:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   72: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   73:     Config.
   74: 
   75: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   76:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   77: 
   78: %% erl_bif_types comes from dialyzer which some test runs skip building, so
   79: %% we'll skip the tests that use it as the result shouldn't vary based on
   80: %% platform. The majority build it so we'll have plenty coverage either way.
   81: skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config) ->
   82:     c:l(erl_bif_types),
   83:     case erlang:function_exported(erl_bif_types, module_info, 0) of
   84:         false -> {skip, "erl_bif_types not compiled"};
   85:         true -> Config
   86:     end.
   87: 
   88: %% Uses erlang:display to test that erts_printf does not do deep recursion
   89: display(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   90:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
   91:     true = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,display_huge,[]),
   92:     peer:stop(Peer),
   93:     ok.
   94: 
   95: display_huge() ->
   96:     erlang:display(deeep(100000)).
   97: 
   98: deeep(0,Acc) ->
   99:     Acc;
  100: deeep(N,Acc) ->
  101:     deeep(N-1,[Acc|[]]).
  102: 
  103: deeep(N) ->
  104:     deeep(N,[hello]).
  105: 
  106: display_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  107:     true = erlang:display_string("hej"),
  108:     true = erlang:display_string(""),
  109:     true = erlang:display_string("hopp"),
  110:     true = erlang:display_string("\n"),
  111:     true = erlang:display_string(lists:seq(1100,1200)),
  112:     {error,badarg} = try
  113:                          erlang:display_string(atom),
  114:                          ok
  115:                      catch
  116:                          T0:E0 ->
  117:                              {T0, E0}
  118:                      end,
  119:     {error,badarg} = try
  120:                          erlang:display_string(make_ref()),
  121:                          ok
  122:                      catch
  123:                          T1:E1 ->
  124:                              {T1, E1}
  125:                      end,
  126:     ok.
  127: 
  128: erl_bif_types(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  129:     List = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  130: 
  131:     KnownTypes = [MFA || MFA <- List, known_types(MFA)],
  132:     io:format("There are ~p BIFs with type information in erl_bif_types.",
  133: 	      [length(KnownTypes)]),
  134:     erl_bif_types_2(KnownTypes).
  135: 
  136: erl_bif_types_2(List) ->
  137:     BadArity = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  138: 		       begin
  139: 			   Types = erl_bif_types:arg_types(M, F, A),
  140: 			   length(Types) =/= A
  141: 		       end],
  142:     case BadArity of
  143: 	[] ->
  144: 	    erl_bif_types_3(List);
  145: 	[_|_] ->
  146: 	    io:put_chars("Bifs with bad arity\n"),
  147: 	    io:format("~p\n", [BadArity]),
  148: 	    ct:fail({length(BadArity),bad_arity})
  149:     end.
  150: 
  151: erl_bif_types_3(List) ->
  152:     BadSmokeTest = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  153: 			   begin
  154: 			       try erl_bif_types:type(M, F, A) of
  155: 				   Type ->
  156: 				       %% Test that type is returned.
  157: 				       not erl_types:is_erl_type(Type)
  158: 			       catch
  159: 				   Class:Error ->
  160: 				       io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n",
  161: 						 [MFA,Class,Error]),
  162: 				       true
  163: 			       end
  164: 			   end],
  165:     case BadSmokeTest of
  166: 	[] ->
  167: 	    ok;
  168: 	[_|_] ->
  169: 	    io:put_chars("Bifs with failing calls to erlang_bif_types:type/3 "
  170: 			 "(or with bogus return values):\n"),
  171: 	    io:format("~p\n", [BadSmokeTest]),
  172: 	    ct:fail({length(BadSmokeTest),bad_smoke_test})
  173:     end.
  174: 
  175: guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types(_Config) ->
  176:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  177:     List = [{F,A} || {erlang,F,A} <- List0,
  178: 		     erl_internal:guard_bif(F, A)],
  179:     Not = [FA || {F,A}=FA <- List,
  180: 		 not erl_bif_types:is_known(erlang, F, A)],
  181:     case Not of
  182: 	[] ->
  183: 	    ok;
  184: 	[_|_] ->
  185: 	    io:put_chars(
  186: 	      ["Dialyzer requires that all guard BIFs "
  187: 	       "have type information in erl_bif_types.\n\n"
  188: 	       "The following guard BIFs have no type information "
  189: 	       "in erl_bif_types:\n\n",
  190: 	       [io_lib:format("  ~p/~p\n", [F,A]) || {F,A} <- Not]]),
  191: 	    ct:fail(erl_bif_types)
  192:     end.
  193: 
  194: shadow_comments(_Config) ->
  195:     ErlangList = [{erlang,F,A} || {F,A} <- erlang:module_info(exports),
  196: 				  not is_operator(F,A)],
  197:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  198:     List1 = [MFA || {M,_,_}=MFA <- List0, M =/= erlang],
  199:     List = List1 ++ ErlangList,
  200:     HasTypes = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  201: 		       erl_bif_types:is_known(M, F, A)],
  202:     Path = get_code_path(),
  203:     BifRel = sofs:relation(HasTypes, [{m,f,a}]),
  204:     BifModules = sofs:to_external(sofs:projection(1, BifRel)),
  205:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod, Path) || Mod <- BifModules],
  206:     Specs0 = [extract_specs(Mod, Abstr) ||
  207: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  208:     Specs = lists:append(Specs0),
  209:     SpecFuns0 = [F || {F,_} <- Specs],
  210:     SpecFuns = sofs:relation(SpecFuns0, [{m,f,a}]),
  211:     HasTypesAndSpecs = sofs:intersection(BifRel, SpecFuns),
  212:     Commented0 = lists:append([extract_comments(Mod, Path) ||
  213: 				  Mod <- BifModules]),
  214:     Commented = sofs:relation(Commented0, [{m,f,a}]),
  215:     {NoComments0,_,NoBifSpecs0} =
  216: 	sofs:symmetric_partition(HasTypesAndSpecs, Commented),
  217:     NoComments = sofs:to_external(NoComments0),
  218:     NoBifSpecs = sofs:to_external(NoBifSpecs0),
  219: 
  220:     case NoComments of
  221: 	[] ->
  222: 	    ok;
  223: 	[_|_] ->
  224: 	    io:put_chars(
  225: 	      ["If a BIF stub has both a spec and has type information in "
  226: 	       "erl_bif_types, there *must*\n"
  227: 	       "be a comment in the source file to make that immediately "
  228: 	       "obvious.\n\nThe following comments are missing:\n\n",
  229: 	       [io_lib:format("%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ~p:~p/~p\n",
  230: 			      [M,F,A]) || {M,F,A} <- NoComments]]),
  231: 	    ct:fail(bif_stub)
  232:     end,
  233: 
  234:     case NoBifSpecs of
  235: 	[] ->
  236: 	    ok;
  237: 	[_|_] ->
  238: 	    io:put_chars(
  239: 	      ["The following functions have \"shadowed\" comments "
  240: 	       "claiming that there is type information in erl_bif_types,\n"
  241: 	       "but actually there is no such type information.\n\n"
  242: 	       "Therefore, the following comments should be removed:\n\n",
  243: 	       [io_lib:format("%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ~p:~p/~p\n",
  244: 			      [M,F,A]) || {M,F,A} <- NoBifSpecs]]),
  245: 	    ct:fail(erl_bif_types)
  246:     end.
  247: 
  248: extract_comments(Mod, Path) ->
  249:     Beam = which(Mod, Path),
  250:     SrcDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(filename:dirname(Beam)), "src"),
  251:     Src = filename:join(SrcDir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl"),
  252:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(Src),
  253:     Lines0 = binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global]),
  254:     Lines1 = [T || <<"%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ",T/binary>> <- Lines0],
  255:     {ok,ReMFA} = re:compile("([^:]*):([^/]*)/(\\d*)"),
  256:     Lines = [L || L <- Lines1, re:run(L, ReMFA, [{capture,[]}]) =:= match],
  257:     [begin
  258: 	 {match,[M,F,A]} = re:run(L, ReMFA, [{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
  259: 	 {list_to_atom(M),list_to_atom(F),list_to_integer(A)}
  260:      end || L <- Lines].
  261: 
  262: known_types({M,F,A}) ->
  263:     erl_bif_types:is_known(M, F, A).
  264: 
  265: specs(_) ->
  266:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  267: 
  268:     %% Ignore all operators.
  269:     List = [MFA || MFA <- List0, not is_operator(MFA)],
  270: 
  271:     %% Extract specs from the abstract code for all BIFs.
  272:     Path = get_code_path(),
  273:     BifRel = sofs:relation(List, [{m,f,a}]),
  274:     BifModules = sofs:to_external(sofs:projection(1, BifRel)),
  275:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod, Path) || Mod <- BifModules],
  276:     Specs0 = [extract_specs(Mod, Abstr) ||
  277: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  278:     Specs = lists:append(Specs0),
  279:     BifSet = sofs:set(List, [function]),
  280:     SpecRel0 = sofs:relation(Specs, [{function,spec}]),
  281:     SpecRel = sofs:restriction(SpecRel0, BifSet),
  282: 
  283:     %% Find BIFs without specs.
  284:     NoSpecs0 = sofs:difference(BifSet, sofs:domain(SpecRel)),
  285:     NoSpecs = sofs:to_external(NoSpecs0),
  286:     case NoSpecs of
  287: 	[] ->
  288: 	    ok;
  289: 	[_|_] ->
  290: 	    io:put_chars("The following BIFs don't have specs:\n"),
  291: 	    [print_mfa(MFA) || MFA <- NoSpecs],
  292: 	    ct:fail(no_spec)
  293:     end.
  294: 
  295: is_operator({erlang,F,A}) ->
  296:     is_operator(F,A);
  297: is_operator(_) -> false.
  298: 
  299: is_operator(F,A) ->
  300:     erl_internal:arith_op(F, A) orelse
  301: 	erl_internal:bool_op(F, A) orelse
  302: 	erl_internal:comp_op(F, A) orelse
  303: 	erl_internal:list_op(F, A) orelse
  304: 	erl_internal:send_op(F, A).
  305:     
  306: extract_specs(M, Abstr) ->
  307:     [{make_mfa(M, Name),Spec} || {attribute,_,spec,{Name,Spec}} <- Abstr].
  308: 
  309: make_mfa(M, {F,A}) -> {M,F,A};
  310: make_mfa(M, {M,_,_}=MFA) -> MFA.
  311: 
  312: improper_bif_stubs(_) ->
  313:     Bifs = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  314:     Path = get_code_path(),
  315:     BifRel = sofs:relation(Bifs, [{m,f,a}]),
  316:     BifModules = sofs:to_external(sofs:projection(1, BifRel)),
  317:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod, Path) || Mod <- BifModules],
  318:     Funcs0 = [extract_functions(Mod, Abstr) ||
  319: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  320:     Funcs = lists:append(Funcs0),
  321:     BifSet = sofs:set(Bifs, [function]),
  322:     FuncRel0 = sofs:relation(Funcs, [{function,code}]),
  323:     FuncRel = sofs:restriction(FuncRel0, BifSet),
  324:     [check_stub(MFA, Body) || {MFA,Body} <- sofs:to_external(FuncRel)],
  325:     ok.
  326: 
  327: auto_imports(_Config) ->
  328:     Path = get_code_path(),
  329:     {erlang,Abstr} = extract_abstract(erlang, Path),
  330:     SpecFuns = [Name || {attribute,_,spec,{Name,_}} <- Abstr],
  331:     auto_imports(SpecFuns, 0).
  332: 
  333: auto_imports([{F,A}|T], Errors) ->
  334:     case erl_internal:bif(F, A) of
  335: 	false ->
  336: 	    io:format("~p/~p: not auto-imported, but spec claims it "
  337: 		      "is auto-imported", [F,A]),
  338: 	    auto_imports(T, Errors+1);
  339: 	true ->
  340: 	    auto_imports(T, Errors)
  341:     end;
  342: auto_imports([{erlang,F,A}|T], Errors) ->
  343:     case erl_internal:bif(F, A) of
  344: 	false ->
  345: 	    auto_imports(T, Errors);
  346: 	true ->
  347: 	    io:format("~p/~p: auto-imported, but "
  348: 		      "spec claims it is *not* auto-imported", [F,A]),
  349: 	    auto_imports(T, Errors+1)
  350:     end;
  351: auto_imports([], 0) ->
  352:     ok;
  353: auto_imports([], Errors) ->
  354:     ct:fail({Errors,inconsistencies}).
  355: 
  356: extract_functions(M, Abstr) ->
  357:     [{{M,F,A},Body} || {function,_,F,A,Body} <- Abstr].
  358: 
  359: check_stub({_,F,A}, B) ->
  360:     try
  361: 	[{clause,_,Args,[],Body}] = B,
  362: 	A = length(Args),
  363: 	[{call,_,{remote,_,{atom,_,erlang},{atom,_,nif_error}},[_]}] = Body
  364:     catch
  365: 	_:_ ->
  366: 	    io:put_chars("Invalid body for the following BIF stub:\n"),
  367: 	    Func = {function,0,F,A,B},
  368: 	    io:put_chars(erl_pp:function(Func)),
  369: 	    io:nl(),
  370: 	    io:put_chars("The body should be: erlang:nif_error(undef)"),
  371: 	    ct:fail(invalid_body)
  372:     end.
  373: 
  374: list_to_utf8_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  375:     'hello' = atom_roundtrip("hello"),
  376:     'こんにちは' = atom_roundtrip("こんにちは"),
  377: 
  378:     %% Test all edge cases.
  379:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#80]),
  380:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#7F]),
  381:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#FF]),
  382:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#100]),
  383:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#7FF]),
  384:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#800]),
  385:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#D7FF]),
  386:     atom_badarg([16#D800]),
  387:     atom_badarg([16#DFFF]),
  388:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#E000]),
  389:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#FFFF]),
  390:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#1000]),
  391:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#10FFFF]),
  392:     atom_badarg([16#110000]),
  393: 
  394:     atom_badarg([-1]),
  395:     [atom_badarg([(-1 bsl N) + $A]) || N <- lists:seq(8,16)],
  396:     ok.
  397: 
  398: atom_roundtrip(String) ->
  399:     Atom = list_to_atom(String),
  400:     Atom = list_to_existing_atom(String),
  401:     String = atom_to_list(Atom),
  402:     Atom.
  403: 
  404: atom_badarg(String) ->
  405:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_atom(String)),
  406:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_existing_atom(String)),
  407:     ok.
  408: 
  409: t_list_to_existing_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  410:     all = list_to_existing_atom("all"),
  411:     ?MODULE = list_to_existing_atom(?MODULE_STRING),
  412:     UnlikelyStr = "dsfj923874390867er869fds9864y97jhg3973qerueoru",
  413:     try
  414: 	list_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyStr),
  415: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  416:     catch
  417: 	error:badarg -> ok
  418:     end,
  419: 
  420:     %% The compiler has become smarter! We need the call to id/1 in
  421:     %% the next line.
  422:     UnlikelyAtom = list_to_atom(id(UnlikelyStr)),
  423:     UnlikelyAtom = list_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyStr),
  424:     ok.
  425: 
  426: os_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  427:     EnvVar1 = "MjhgvFDrresdCghN mnjkUYg vfrD",
  428:     false = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  429:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, "mors"),
  430:     "mors" = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  431:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, ""),
  432:     case os:getenv(EnvVar1) of
  433: 	      "" -> ok;
  434: 	      false -> ok;
  435: 	      BadVal -> ct:fail(BadVal)
  436: 	  end,
  437:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, "mors"),
  438:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar1),
  439:     false = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  440:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar1), % unset unset variable
  441:     %% os:putenv, os:getenv and os:unsetenv currently use a temp
  442:     %% buffer of size 1024 for storing key+value
  443:     os_env_long(1010, 1030, "hej hopp").
  444:     
  445: os_env_long(Min, Max, _Value) when Min > Max ->
  446:     ok;
  447: os_env_long(Min, Max, Value) ->
  448:     EnvVar = lists:duplicate(Min, $X),
  449:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar, Value),
  450:     Value = os:getenv(EnvVar),
  451:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar),
  452:     os_env_long(Min+1, Max, Value).
  453: 
  454: os_env_case_sensitivity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  455:     %% The keys in os:getenv/putenv must be case-insensitive on Windows, and
  456:     %% case-sensitive elsewhere.
  457:     true = os:putenv("os_env_gurka", "gaffel"),
  458:     Expected = case os:type() of
  459:                    {win32, _} -> "gaffel";
  460:                    _ -> false
  461:                end,
  462:     Expected = os:getenv("OS_ENV_GURKA"),
  463:     ok.
  464: 
  465: %% Test that string:to_integer does not Halloc in wrong order.
  466: otp_7526(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  467:     ok = test_7526(256).
  468: 
  469: iterate_7526(0, Acc) -> Acc;
  470: iterate_7526(N, Acc) ->
  471:     iterate_7526(N - 1,
  472: 		 [case string:to_integer("9223372036854775808,\n") of
  473: 		      {Int, _Foo} -> Int
  474: 		  end | Acc]).
  475: 
  476: do_test_7526(N,M) ->
  477:     {Self, Ref} = {self(), make_ref()},
  478:     T = erlang:make_tuple(M,0),
  479:     spawn_opt(fun()->
  480:                       L = iterate_7526(N, []),
  481:                       BadList = [X || X <- L, X =/= 9223372036854775808],
  482:                       BadLen = length(BadList),
  483:                       M = length(tuple_to_list(T)),
  484:                       %%io:format("~b bad conversions: ~p~n", [BadLen, BadList]),
  485:                       Self ! {done, Ref, BadLen}
  486:               end,
  487:               [link,{fullsweep_after,0}]),
  488:     receive {done, Ref, Len} -> Len end.
  489: 
  490: 
  491: test_7526(0) ->
  492:     ok;
  493: test_7526(N) ->
  494:     case do_test_7526(1000,N) of
  495: 	0 -> test_7526(N-1);
  496: 	Other ->
  497: 	    {error,N,Other}
  498:     end.
  499: 
  500: -define(BADARG(E), {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch E)).
  501: -define(SYS_LIMIT(E), {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch E)).
  502: 
  503: t_binary_to_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  504:     HalfLong = lists:seq(0, 127),
  505:     HalfLongAtom = list_to_atom(HalfLong),
  506:     HalfLongBin = list_to_binary(HalfLong),
  507:     Long = lists:seq(0, 254),
  508:     LongAtom = list_to_atom(Long),
  509:     LongBin = list_to_binary(Long),
  510:     UnicodeLongAtom = list_to_atom([$é || _ <- lists:seq(0, 254)]),
  511:     UnicodeLongBin = << <<"é"/utf8>> || _ <- lists:seq(0, 254)>>,
  512: 
  513:     %% latin1
  514:     '' = test_binary_to_atom(<<>>, latin1),
  515:     '\377' = test_binary_to_atom(<<255>>, latin1),
  516:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, latin1),
  517:     LongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(LongBin, latin1),
  518: 
  519:     %% utf8
  520:     '' = test_binary_to_atom(<<>>, utf8),
  521:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, utf8),
  522:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, unicode),
  523:     UnicodeLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(UnicodeLongBin, utf8),
  524:     UnicodeLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(UnicodeLongBin, unicode),
  525:     [] = [C || C <- lists:seq(128, 255),
  526: 		     begin
  527: 			 list_to_atom([C]) =/=
  528: 			     test_binary_to_atom(<<C/utf8>>, utf8)
  529: 		     end],
  530: 
  531:     ExoticBin = <<"こんにちは"/utf8>>,
  532:     ExoticAtom = test_binary_to_atom(ExoticBin, utf8),
  533:     ExoticBin = atom_to_binary(ExoticAtom, utf8),
  534:     ExoticBin = atom_to_binary(ExoticAtom),
  535: 
  536:     %% badarg failures.
  537:     fail_binary_to_atom(atom),
  538:     fail_binary_to_atom(42),
  539:     fail_binary_to_atom({a,b,c}),
  540:     fail_binary_to_atom([1,2,3]),
  541:     fail_binary_to_atom([]),
  542:     fail_binary_to_atom(42.0),
  543:     fail_binary_to_atom(self()),
  544:     fail_binary_to_atom(make_ref()),
  545:     fail_binary_to_atom(<<0:7>>),
  546:     fail_binary_to_atom(<<42:13>>),
  547:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<>>), blurf)),
  548:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<>>), [])),
  549: 
  550:     %% Bad UTF8 sequences.
  551:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255>>), utf8)),
  552:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255>>))),
  553:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255,0>>), utf8)),
  554:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<16#C0,16#80>>), utf8)), %Overlong 0.
  555:     <<B:1/binary, _/binary>> = id(<<194, 163>>), %Truncated character ERL-474
  556:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(B, utf8)),
  557: 
  558:     %% system_limit failures.
  559:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255>>), utf8)),
  560:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255>>))),
  561:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255,0>>), utf8)),
  562:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:256/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  563:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:257/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  564:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:512/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  565:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:256/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  566:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:257/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  567:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:512/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  568:     ok.
  569: 
  570: test_binary_to_atom(Bin0, Encoding) ->
  571:     Res = binary_to_atom(Bin0, Encoding),
  572:     Res = binary_to_existing_atom(Bin0, Encoding),
  573:     if
  574:         Encoding =:= utf8;
  575:         Encoding =:= unicode ->
  576:             Res = binary_to_atom(Bin0),
  577:             Res = binary_to_existing_atom(Bin0);
  578:        true ->
  579:             ok
  580:     end,
  581:     Bin1 = id(<<7:3,Bin0/binary,32:5>>),
  582:     Sz = byte_size(Bin0),
  583:     <<_:3,UnalignedBin:Sz/binary,_:5>> = Bin1,
  584:     Res = binary_to_atom(UnalignedBin, Encoding).
  585: 
  586: fail_binary_to_atom(Bin) ->
  587:     try
  588:         binary_to_atom(Bin, latin1)
  589:     catch
  590:         error:badarg ->
  591:             ok
  592:     end,
  593:     try
  594:         binary_to_atom(Bin, utf8)
  595:     catch
  596:         error:badarg ->
  597:             ok
  598:     end,
  599:     try
  600:         binary_to_atom(Bin)
  601:     catch
  602:         error:badarg ->
  603:             ok
  604:     end,
  605:     try
  606:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin, latin1)
  607:     catch
  608:         error:badarg ->
  609:             ok
  610:     end,
  611:     try
  612:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin, utf8)
  613:     catch
  614:         error:badarg ->
  615:             ok
  616:     end,
  617:     try
  618:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin)
  619:     catch
  620:         error:badarg ->
  621:             ok
  622:     end.
  623: 	
  624: 
  625: t_binary_to_existing_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  626:     UnlikelyBin = <<"ou0897979655678dsfj923874390867er869fds973qerueoru">>,
  627:     try
  628: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, latin1),
  629: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  630:     catch
  631: 	error:badarg -> ok
  632:     end,
  633: 
  634:     try
  635: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, utf8),
  636: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  637:     catch
  638: 	error:badarg -> ok
  639:     end,
  640:     try
  641: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin),
  642: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  643:     catch
  644: 	error:badarg -> ok
  645:     end,
  646: 
  647:     UnlikelyAtom = binary_to_atom(id(UnlikelyBin), latin1),
  648:     UnlikelyAtom = binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, latin1),
  649: 
  650:     %% ERL-944; a binary that was too large would overflow the latin1-to-utf8
  651:     %% conversion buffer.
  652:     OverflowAtom = <<0:511/unit:8,
  653:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  654:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  655:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  656:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133>>,
  657:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch binary_to_existing_atom(OverflowAtom, latin1)),
  658: 
  659:     ok.
  660: 
  661: 
  662: t_atom_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  663:     HalfLong = lists:seq(0, 127),
  664:     HalfLongAtom = list_to_atom(HalfLong),
  665:     HalfLongBin = list_to_binary(HalfLong),
  666:     Long = lists:seq(0, 254),
  667:     LongAtom = list_to_atom(Long),
  668:     LongBin = list_to_binary(Long),
  669: 
  670:     %% latin1
  671:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', latin1),
  672:     <<"abc">> = atom_to_binary(abc, latin1),
  673:     <<127>> = atom_to_binary('\177', latin1),
  674:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom, latin1),
  675:     LongBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom, latin1),
  676: 
  677:     %% utf8.
  678:     <<>> = atom_to_binary(''),
  679:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', utf8),
  680:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', unicode),
  681:     <<127>> = atom_to_binary('\177', utf8),
  682:     <<"abcdef">> = atom_to_binary(abcdef, utf8),
  683:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom, utf8),
  684:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom),
  685:     LongAtomBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom, utf8),
  686:     LongAtomBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom),
  687:     verify_long_atom_bin(LongAtomBin, 0),
  688: 
  689:     %% Failing cases.
  690:     fail_atom_to_binary(<<1>>),
  691:     fail_atom_to_binary(42),
  692:     fail_atom_to_binary({a,b,c}),
  693:     fail_atom_to_binary([1,2,3]),
  694:     fail_atom_to_binary([]),
  695:     fail_atom_to_binary(42.0),
  696:     fail_atom_to_binary(self()),
  697:     fail_atom_to_binary(make_ref()),
  698:     ?BADARG(atom_to_binary(id(a), blurf)),
  699:     ?BADARG(atom_to_binary(id(b), [])),
  700:     ok.
  701: 
  702: verify_long_atom_bin(<<I/utf8,T/binary>>, I) ->
  703:     verify_long_atom_bin(T, I+1);
  704: verify_long_atom_bin(<<>>, 255) -> ok.
  705: 
  706: fail_atom_to_binary(Term) ->
  707:     try
  708:         atom_to_binary(Term, latin1)
  709:     catch
  710:         error:badarg ->
  711:             ok
  712:     end,
  713:     try
  714:         atom_to_binary(Term, utf8)
  715:     catch
  716:         error:badarg ->
  717:             ok
  718:     end,
  719:     try
  720:         atom_to_binary(Term)
  721:     catch
  722:         error:badarg ->
  723:             ok
  724:     end.
  725: 
  726: 
  727: min_max(Config) when is_list(Config) ->	
  728:     a = erlang:min(id(a), a),
  729:     a = erlang:min(id(a), b),
  730:     a = erlang:min(id(b), a),
  731:     b = erlang:min(id(b), b),
  732:     a = erlang:max(id(a), a),
  733:     b = erlang:max(id(a), b),
  734:     b = erlang:max(id(b), a),
  735:     b = erlang:max(id(b), b),
  736: 
  737:     42.0 = erlang:min(42.0, 42),
  738:     42.0 = erlang:max(42.0, 42),
  739:     %% And now (R14) they are also autoimported!
  740:     a = min(id(a), a),
  741:     a = min(id(a), b),
  742:     a = min(id(b), a),
  743:     b = min(id(b), b),
  744:     a = max(id(a), a),
  745:     b = max(id(a), b),
  746:     b = max(id(b), a),
  747:     b = max(id(b), b),
  748: 
  749:     42.0 = min(42.0, 42),
  750:     42.0 = max(42.0, 42),
  751:     ok.
  752:

  754: 
  755: erlang_halt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  756:     try erlang:halt(undefined) of
  757: 	_-> ct:fail({erlang,halt,{undefined}})
  758:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  759:     try halt(undefined) of
  760: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{undefined}})
  761:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  762:     try erlang:halt(undefined, []) of
  763: 	_-> ct:fail({erlang,halt,{undefined,[]}})
  764:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  765:     try halt(undefined, []) of
  766: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{undefined,[]}})
  767:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  768:     try halt(0, undefined) of
  769: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,undefined}})
  770:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  771:     try halt(0, [undefined]) of
  772: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[undefined]}})
  773:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  774:     try halt(0, [{undefined,true}]) of
  775: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{undefined,true}]}})
  776:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  777:     try halt(0, [{flush,undefined}]) of
  778: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{flush,undefined}]}})
  779:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  780:     try halt(0, [{flush,true,undefined}]) of
  781: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{flush,true,undefined}]}})
  782:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  783:     {ok, _, N1} = ?CT_PEER(),
  784:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N1, erlang, halt, []),
  785:     {ok, _, N2} = ?CT_PEER(),
  786:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N2, erlang, halt, [0]),
  787:     {ok, _, N3} = ?CT_PEER(),
  788:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N3, erlang, halt, [0,[]]),
  789:     {ok, _, N4} = ?CT_PEER(),
  790:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N4, erlang, halt, [lists:duplicate(300,$x)]),
  791:     %% Test unicode slogan
  792:     {ok, _, N5} = ?CT_PEER(),
  793:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N5, erlang, halt, [[339,338,254,230,198,295,167,223,32,12507,12531,12480]]),
  794: 
  795:     % This test triggers a segfault when dumping a crash dump
  796:     % to make sure that we can handle it properly.
  797: 
  798:     %% Prevent address sanitizer from catching SEGV in slave node
  799:     AsanOpts = add_asan_opt("handle_segv=0"),
  800:     {ok, _, N6} = ?CT_PEER(),
  801:     reset_asan_opts(AsanOpts),
  802: 
  803:     CrashDump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  804:                               "segfault_erl_crash.dump"),
  805:     true = rpc:call(N6, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",CrashDump]),
  806:     false = rpc:call(N6, erts_debug, set_internal_state,
  807:                      [available_internal_state, true]),
  808:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N6, erts_debug, set_internal_state,
  809:                                  [broken_halt, "Validate correct crash dump"]),
  810:     {ok,_} = wait_until_stable_size(CrashDump,-1),
  811:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(CrashDump),
  812:     case {string:find(Bin, <<"\n=end\n">>),
  813:           string:find(Bin, <<"\r\n=end\r\n">>)} of
  814:         {nomatch,nomatch} ->
  815:             ct:fail("Could not find end marker in crash dump");
  816:         {_,_} ->
  817:             ok
  818:     end.
  819: 
  820: add_asan_opt(Opt) ->
  821:     case test_server:is_asan() of
  822: 	true ->
  823: 	    case os:getenv("ASAN_OPTIONS") of
  824: 		false ->
  825: 		    os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", Opt),
  826: 		    undefined;
  827: 		AO ->
  828: 		    os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", AO ++ [$: | Opt]),
  829: 		    AO
  830: 	    end;
  831: 	_ ->
  832: 	    false
  833:     end.
  834: 
  835: reset_asan_opts(false) -> ok;
  836: reset_asan_opts(undefined) -> os:unsetenv("ASAN_OPTIONS");
  837: reset_asan_opts(AO) -> os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", AO).
  838: 
  839: wait_until_stable_size(_File,-10) ->
  840:     {error,enoent};
  841: wait_until_stable_size(File,PrevSz) ->
  842:     timer:sleep(250),
  843:     case file:read_file_info(File) of
  844:         {error,enoent} ->
  845:             wait_until_stable_size(File,PrevSz-1);
  846:         {ok,#file_info{size = PrevSz }} when PrevSz /= -1 ->
  847:             io:format("Crashdump file size was: ~p (~s)~n",[PrevSz,File]),
  848:             {ok,PrevSz};
  849:         {ok,#file_info{size = NewSz }} ->
  850:             wait_until_stable_size(File,NewSz)
  851:     end.
  852: 
  853: % Test erlang:halt with ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES
  854: erl_crash_dump_bytes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  855:     Bytes = 1000,
  856:     CrashDump = do_limited_crash_dump(Config, Bytes),
  857:     {ok,ActualBytes} = wait_until_stable_size(CrashDump,-1),
  858:     true = ActualBytes < (Bytes + 100),
  859: 
  860:     NoDump = do_limited_crash_dump(Config,0),
  861:     {error,enoent} = wait_until_stable_size(NoDump,-8),
  862:     ok.
  863: 
  864: do_limited_crash_dump(Config, Bytes) ->
  865:     {ok, _, N} = ?CT_PEER(),
  866:     BytesStr = integer_to_list(Bytes),
  867:     CrashDump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  868:                               "erl_crash." ++ BytesStr ++ ".dump"),
  869:     true = rpc:call(N, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",CrashDump]),
  870:     true = rpc:call(N, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES",BytesStr]),
  871:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N, erlang, halt, ["Testing ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES"]),
  872:     CrashDump.
  873: 
  874: 
  875: is_builtin(_Config) ->
  876:     Exp0 = [{M,F,A} || {M,_} <- code:all_loaded(),
  877: 		       {F,A} <- M:module_info(exports)],
  878:     Exp = ordsets:from_list(Exp0),
  879: 
  880:     %% Built-ins implemented as special instructions.
  881:     Instructions = [{erlang,apply,2},{erlang,apply,3},{erlang,yield,0}],
  882: 
  883:     Builtins0 = Instructions ++ erlang:system_info(snifs),
  884:     Builtins = ordsets:from_list(Builtins0),
  885: 
  886:     Fakes = [{M,F,42} || {M,F,_} <- Instructions],
  887:     All = ordsets:from_list(Fakes ++ Exp),
  888:     NotBuiltin = ordsets:subtract(All, Builtins),
  889: 
  890:     _ = [{true,_} = {erlang:is_builtin(M, F, A),MFA} ||
  891:             {M,F,A}=MFA <- Builtins],
  892:     _ = [{false,_} = {erlang:is_builtin(M, F, A),MFA} ||
  893:             {M,F,A}=MFA <- NotBuiltin],
  894: 
  895:     ok.
  896: 
  897: error_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  898:     error_stacktrace_test().
  899: 
  900: error_stacktrace_during_call_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  901:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun () ->
  902: 				receive after infinity -> ok end
  903: 			end),
  904:     Mprog = [{'_',[],[{exception_trace}]}],
  905:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,'_','_'}, Mprog, [local]),
  906:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,2}, Mprog, [local]),
  907:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,1}, Mprog, [local]),
  908:     erlang:trace(all, true, [call,return_to,timestamp,{tracer, Tracer}]),
  909:     try
  910: 	error_stacktrace_test()
  911:     after
  912: 	erlang:trace(all, false, [call,return_to,timestamp,{tracer, Tracer}]),
  913: 	erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,2}, false, [local]),
  914: 	erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,1}, false, [local]),
  915: 	erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,'_','_'}, false, [local]),
  916: 	unlink(Tracer),
  917: 	exit(Tracer, kill),
  918: 	Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Tracer),
  919: 	receive
  920: 	    {'DOWN', Mon, process, Tracer, _} -> ok
  921: 	end
  922:     end,
  923:     ok.
  924: 
  925: error_stacktrace_test() ->
  926:     Types = [apply_const_last, apply_const, apply_last,
  927: 	     apply, double_apply_const_last, double_apply_const,
  928: 	     double_apply_last, double_apply, multi_apply_const_last,
  929:              apply_const_only, apply_only,
  930: 	     multi_apply_const, multi_apply_last, multi_apply,
  931: 	     call_const_last, call_last, call_const, call],
  932:     lists:foreach(fun (Type) ->
  933: 			  {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
  934: 					 fun () ->
  935: 						 stk([a,b,c,d], Type, error_2)
  936: 					 end),
  937: 			  receive
  938: 			      {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
  939: 				  {oops, Stack} = Reason,
  940: %%				  io:format("Type: ~p Stack: ~p~n",
  941: %%					    [Type, Stack]),
  942: 				  [{?MODULE, do_error_2, [Type], _},
  943: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _},
  944: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _}] = Stack
  945: 			  end
  946: 		  end,
  947: 		  Types),
  948:     lists:foreach(fun (Type) ->
  949: 			  {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
  950: 					 fun () ->
  951: 						 stk([a,b,c,d], Type, error_1)
  952: 					 end),
  953: 			  receive
  954: 			      {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
  955: 				  {oops, Stack} = Reason,
  956: %%				  io:format("Type: ~p Stack: ~p~n",
  957: %%					    [Type, Stack]),
  958: 				  [{?MODULE, do_error_1, 1, _},
  959: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _},
  960: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _}] = Stack
  961: 			  end
  962: 		  end,
  963: 		  Types),
  964:     ok.
  965: 
  966: stk([_|L], Type, Func) ->
  967:     stk(L, Type, Func),
  968:     %% Force the compiler to keep this body-recursive. We want the stack trace
  969:     %% to have one entry here and another in the base case to test that
  970:     %% multiple frames in the same function aren't removed unless they're
  971:     %% identical.
  972:     id(ok);
  973: stk([], Type, Func) ->
  974:     put(erlang, erlang),
  975:     put(tail, []),
  976:     tail(Type, Func, jump),
  977:     id(ok).
  978: 
  979: tail(Type, Func, jump) ->
  980:     tail(Type, Func, do);
  981: tail(Type, error_1, do) ->
  982:     do_error_1(Type);
  983: tail(Type, error_2, do) ->
  984:     do_error_2(Type).
  985: 
  986: do_error_2(apply_const_only) ->
  987:     apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const_only]]);
  988: do_error_2(apply_only) ->
  989:     Erlang = get(erlang),
  990:     Tail = get(tail),
  991:     apply(Erlang, error, [oops, [apply_only|Tail]]);
  992: do_error_2(apply_const_last) ->
  993:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const_last]]);
  994: do_error_2(apply_const) ->
  995:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const]]),
  996:     ok;
  997: do_error_2(apply_last) ->
  998:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [apply_last]]));
  999: do_error_2(apply) ->
 1000:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [apply]])),
 1001:     ok;
 1002: do_error_2(double_apply_const_last) ->
 1003:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [double_apply_const_last]]]);
 1004: do_error_2(double_apply_const) ->
 1005:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [double_apply_const]]]),
 1006:     ok;
 1007: do_error_2(double_apply_last) ->
 1008:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [double_apply_last]])]);
 1009: do_error_2(double_apply) ->
 1010:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [double_apply]])]),
 1011:     ok;
 1012: do_error_2(multi_apply_const_last) ->
 1013:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [multi_apply_const_last]]]]]);
 1014: do_error_2(multi_apply_const) ->
 1015:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [multi_apply_const]]]]]),
 1016:     ok;
 1017: do_error_2(multi_apply_last) ->
 1018:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [multi_apply_last]])]]]);
 1019: do_error_2(multi_apply) ->
 1020:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [multi_apply]])]]]),
 1021:     ok;
 1022: do_error_2(call_const_last) ->
 1023:     erlang:error(oops, [call_const_last]);
 1024: do_error_2(call_last) ->
 1025:     erlang:error(id(oops), id([call_last]));
 1026: do_error_2(call_const) ->
 1027:     erlang:error(oops, [call_const]),
 1028:     ok;
 1029: do_error_2(call) ->
 1030:     erlang:error(id(oops), id([call])).
 1031: 
 1032: 
 1033: do_error_1(apply_const_only) ->
 1034:     apply(erlang, error, [oops]);
 1035: do_error_1(apply_only) ->
 1036:     Erlang = get(erlang),
 1037:     Tail = get(tail),
 1038:     apply(Erlang, error, [oops|Tail]);
 1039: do_error_1(apply_const_last) ->
 1040:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops]);
 1041: do_error_1(apply_const) ->
 1042:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops]),
 1043:     ok;
 1044: do_error_1(apply_last) ->
 1045:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops]));
 1046: do_error_1(apply) ->
 1047:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])),
 1048:     ok;
 1049: do_error_1(double_apply_const_last) ->
 1050:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]);
 1051: do_error_1(double_apply_const) ->
 1052:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]),
 1053:     ok;
 1054: do_error_1(double_apply_last) ->
 1055:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]);
 1056: do_error_1(double_apply) ->
 1057:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]),
 1058:     ok;
 1059: do_error_1(multi_apply_const_last) ->
 1060:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]]]);
 1061: do_error_1(multi_apply_const) ->
 1062:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]]]),
 1063:     ok;
 1064: do_error_1(multi_apply_last) ->
 1065:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]]]);
 1066: do_error_1(multi_apply) ->
 1067:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]]]),
 1068:     ok;
 1069: do_error_1(call_const_last) ->
 1070:     erlang:error(oops);
 1071: do_error_1(call_last) ->
 1072:     erlang:error(id(oops));
 1073: do_error_1(call_const) ->
 1074:     erlang:error(oops),
 1075:     ok;
 1076: do_error_1(call) ->
 1077:     erlang:error(id(oops)).
 1078: 
 1079: 
 1080: group_leader_prio(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1081:     group_leader_prio_test(false).
 1082: 
 1083: group_leader_prio_dirty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1084:     group_leader_prio_test(true).
 1085: 
 1086: group_leader_prio_test(Dirty) ->
 1087:     %%
 1088:     %% Unfortunately back in the days node local group_leader/2 was not
 1089:     %% implemented as sending an asynchronous signal to the process to change
 1090:     %% group leader for. Instead it has always been synchronously changed, and
 1091:     %% nothing in the documentation have hinted otherwise... Therefore I do not
 1092:     %% dare the change this.
 1093:     %%
 1094:     %% In order to prevent priority inversion, the priority of the receiver of
 1095:     %% the group leader signal is elevated while handling incoming signals if
 1096:     %% the sender has a higher priority than the receiver. This test tests that
 1097:     %% the priority elevation actually works...
 1098:     %%
 1099:     Tester = self(),
 1100:     Init = erlang:whereis(init),
 1101:     GL = erlang:group_leader(),
 1102:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1103:     {TestProcFun, NTestProcs}
 1104:         = case Dirty of
 1105:               false ->
 1106:                   %% These processes will handle all incoming signals
 1107:                   %% by them selves...
 1108:                   {fun () ->
 1109:                            Tester ! {alive, self()},
 1110:                            receive after infinity -> ok end
 1111:                    end,
 1112:                    100};
 1113:               true ->
 1114:                   %% These processes won't handle incoming signals by
 1115:                   %% them selves since they are stuck on dirty schedulers
 1116:                   %% when we try to change group leader. A dirty process
 1117:                   %% signal handler process (system process) will be notified
 1118:                   %% of the need to handle incoming signals for these processes,
 1119:                   %% and will instead handle the signal for these processes...
 1120:                   {fun () ->
 1121:                            %% The following sends the message '{alive, self()}'
 1122:                            %% to Tester once on a dirty io scheduler, then wait
 1123:                            %% there until the process terminates...
 1124:                            erts_debug:dirty_io(alive_waitexiting, Tester)
 1125:                    end,
 1126:                    erlang:system_info(dirty_io_schedulers)}
 1127:           end,
 1128:     TPs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1129:                             spawn_opt(TestProcFun,
 1130:                                       [link, {priority, normal}])
 1131:                     end, lists:seq(1, NTestProcs)),
 1132:     lists:foreach(fun (TP) -> receive {alive, TP} -> ok end end, TPs),
 1133:     TLs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1134:                             spawn_opt(fun () -> tok_loop() end,
 1135:                                       [link, {priority, high}])
 1136:                     end,
 1137:                     lists:seq(1, 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers))),
 1138:     %% Wait to ensure distribution of high prio processes over schedulers...
 1139:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1140:     %%
 1141:     %% Test that we can get group-leader signals through to normal prio
 1142:     %% processes from a max prio process even though all schedulers are filled
 1143:     %% with executing high prio processes.
 1144:     %%
 1145:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 1146:                           lists:foreach(fun (TP) ->
 1147:                                                 erlang:yield(),
 1148:                                                 %% whitebox -- Enqueue some signals on it
 1149:                                                 %% preventing us from hogging its main lock
 1150:                                                 %% and set group-leader directly....
 1151:                                                 erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, TP)),
 1152:                                                 true = erlang:group_leader(Init, TP),
 1153:                                                 {group_leader, Init} = process_info(TP, group_leader),
 1154:                                                 erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, TP)),
 1155:                                                 true = erlang:group_leader(GL, TP),
 1156:                                                 {group_leader, GL} = process_info(TP, group_leader)
 1157:                                         end,
 1158:                                         TPs)
 1159:                   end,
 1160:                   lists:seq(1,100)),
 1161:     %%
 1162:     %% Also test when it is exiting...
 1163:     %%
 1164:     lists:foreach(fun (TP) ->
 1165:                           erlang:yield(),
 1166:                           M = erlang:monitor(process, TP),
 1167:                           unlink(TP),
 1168:                           exit(TP, bang),
 1169:                           badarg = try
 1170:                                        true = erlang:group_leader(Init, TP)
 1171:                                    catch
 1172:                                        error : What -> What
 1173:                                    end,
 1174:                           receive
 1175:                               {'DOWN', M, process, TP, Reason} ->
 1176:                                   bang = Reason
 1177:                           end
 1178:                   end,
 1179:                   TPs),
 1180:     lists:foreach(fun (TL) ->
 1181:                           M = erlang:monitor(process, TL),
 1182:                           unlink(TL),
 1183:                           exit(TL, bang),
 1184:                           receive
 1185:                               {'DOWN', M, process, TL, Reason} ->
 1186:                                   bang = Reason
 1187:                           end
 1188:                   end,
 1189:                   TLs),
 1190:     ok.
 1191: 
 1192: is_process_alive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1193:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1194:     Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1195:                            spawn_opt(fun () -> tok_loop() end,
 1196:                                      [{priority, high}, link])
 1197:                    end,
 1198:                    lists:seq(1, 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers))),
 1199:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Wait for load to spread
 1200:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1201:                           %% Ensure that signal order is preserved
 1202:                           %% and that we are not starved due to
 1203:                           %% priority inversion
 1204:                           true = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1205:                           unlink(P),
 1206:                           true = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1207:                           exit(P, kill),
 1208:                           false = erlang:is_process_alive(P)
 1209:                   end,
 1210:                   Ps),
 1211:     ok.
 1212: 
 1213: is_process_alive_signal_from(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1214:     process_flag(priority, high),
 1215:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1216:     Schdlr = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1217:                  1 -> 1;
 1218:                  _ -> 2
 1219:              end,
 1220:     X = is_process_alive_signal_from_test(100000, 0, Schdlr),
 1221:     erlang:display({exits_detected, X}),
 1222:     {comment, integer_to_list(X) ++ " exited processes detected"}.
 1223: 
 1224: is_process_alive_signal_from_test(0, X, _Schdlr) ->
 1225:     X;
 1226: is_process_alive_signal_from_test(N, X, Schdlr) ->
 1227:     Tester = self(),
 1228:     {Testee, TMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1229:                                        Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1230:                                        Tester ! {self(), ready},
 1231:                                        busy_wait_go(),
 1232:                                        _ = erlang:demonitor(Mon),
 1233:                                        exit(normal)
 1234:                                end,
 1235:                                [link,
 1236:                                 monitor,
 1237:                                 {priority, high},
 1238:                                 {scheduler, Schdlr}]),
 1239:     receive {Testee, ready} -> ok end,
 1240:     {monitored_by, MBList1} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 1241:     true = lists:member(Testee, MBList1),
 1242:     erlang:yield(),
 1243:     Testee ! {go, ok},
 1244:     erlang:yield(),
 1245:     NewX = case erlang:is_process_alive(Testee) of
 1246:                true ->
 1247:                    X;
 1248:                false ->
 1249:                    %% Demonitor signal should have reached us before the
 1250:                    %% is-process-alive reply...
 1251:                    {monitored_by, MBList2} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 1252:                    false = lists:member(Testee, MBList2),
 1253:                    X+1
 1254:            end,
 1255:     receive {'DOWN', TMon, process, Testee, normal} -> ok end,
 1256:     is_process_alive_signal_from_test(N-1, NewX, Schdlr).
 1257: 
 1258: process_info_blast(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1259:     Tester = self(),
 1260:     NoAttackers = 1000,
 1261:     NoAL = lists:seq(1, NoAttackers),
 1262:     Consume = make_ref(),
 1263:     Victim = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1264:                                 receive
 1265:                                     Consume ->
 1266:                                         ok
 1267:                                 end,
 1268:                                 consume_msgs()
 1269:                         end),
 1270:     AFun = fun () ->
 1271:                    Victim ! hej,
 1272:                    Res = process_info(Victim, message_queue_len),
 1273:                    Tester ! {self(), Res}
 1274:            end,
 1275:     Attackers0 = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1276:                                    spawn_link(AFun)
 1277:                            end,
 1278:                            NoAL),
 1279:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
 1280:                           receive
 1281:                               {A, Res} ->
 1282:                                   case Res of
 1283:                                       {message_queue_len, Len} when Len > 0, Len =< NoAttackers ->
 1284:                                           Len;
 1285:                                       Error ->
 1286:                                           exit({unexpected, Error})
 1287:                                   end
 1288:                           end
 1289:                   end,
 1290:                   Attackers0),
 1291:     Attackers1 = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1292:                                    spawn_link(AFun)
 1293:                            end,
 1294:                            NoAL),
 1295:     Victim ! Consume,
 1296:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
 1297:                           receive
 1298:                               {A, Res} ->
 1299:                                   case Res of
 1300:                                       {message_queue_len, Len} when Len >= 0, Len =< 2*NoAttackers+1 ->
 1301:                                           ok;
 1302:                                       undefined ->
 1303:                                           ok;
 1304:                                       Error ->
 1305:                                           exit({unexpected, Error})
 1306:                                   end
 1307:                           end
 1308:                   end,
 1309:                   Attackers1),
 1310:     KillFun = fun (P) ->
 1311:                       unlink(P),
 1312:                       exit(P, kill),
 1313:                       false = erlang:is_process_alive(P)
 1314:               end,
 1315:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> KillFun(A) end, Attackers0),
 1316:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> KillFun(A) end, Attackers1),
 1317:     KillFun(Victim),
 1318:     ok.
 1319: 
 1320: consume_msgs() ->
 1321:     receive
 1322:         _ ->
 1323:             consume_msgs()
 1324:     after 0 ->
 1325:               ok
 1326:     end.
 1327: 
 1328: 
 1329: %% Test that process_info(Pid, [message_queue_len]) works correctly when
 1330: %%  fetching part of the middle signal queue into inner queue.
 1331: verify_middle_queue_save(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1332:     Control = self(),
 1333:     ProcessToHang = spawn_link(
 1334:         fun () ->
 1335:             Single = self(),
 1336:             put(count, 0),
 1337:             Doubles = [spawn_link(fun () -> message_queue_len_retrievers(Single, 0) end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 2)],
 1338:             Control ! {doubles, Doubles},
 1339:             process_that_hangs(Control, 0, Doubles)
 1340:         end),
 1341:     ensure_not_hanging(ProcessToHang, [], 50000).
 1342: 
 1343: process_that_hangs(Control, Total, Doubles) ->
 1344:     put(count, Total),
 1345:     %% fetch something innocent, like 'priority' of the process
 1346:     [process_info(Pid, [priority]) || Pid <- Doubles],
 1347:     Control ! alive,
 1348:     process_that_hangs(Control, Total + 1, Doubles).
 1349: 
 1350: message_queue_len_retrievers(Control, PrevCount) ->
 1351:     %% need to fetch dictionary for test reasons, but actual trigger is 'message_queue_len',
 1352:     %%  or 'memory', or 'total_heap_size' - anything that needs to fetch external message queue
 1353:     %%  via ERTS_PI_FLAG_NEED_MSGQ_LEN internal flag to process_info
 1354:     [_, {dictionary, [{count, Count}]}] = erlang:process_info(Control, [message_queue_len, dictionary]),
 1355:     Count > PrevCount andalso begin Control ! count end,
 1356:     message_queue_len_retrievers(Control, Count).
 1357: 
 1358: ensure_not_hanging(Proc, _Doubles, 0) ->
 1359:     unlink(Proc),
 1360:     exit(Proc, kill);
 1361: ensure_not_hanging(Proc, Doubles, Remaining) ->
 1362:     receive
 1363:         alive ->
 1364:             ensure_not_hanging(Proc, Doubles, Remaining - 1);
 1365:         {doubles, NewDoubles} ->
 1366:             ensure_not_hanging(Proc, NewDoubles, Remaining)
 1367:     after 1000 ->
 1368:         Reason = {Proc, "hung", erlang:process_info(Proc, backtrace)},
 1369:         unlink(Proc),
 1370:         exit(Proc, kill),
 1371:         ct:fail(Reason)
 1372:     end.
 1373: 
 1374: %% Test that length/1 returns the correct result after trapping, and
 1375: %% also that the argument is correct in the stacktrace for a badarg
 1376: %% exception.
 1377: 
 1378: test_length(_Config) ->
 1379:     {Start,Inc} = case test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() of
 1380:                       1 -> {16*4000,3977};
 1381:                       _ -> {100,1}
 1382:             end,
 1383:     Good = lists:reverse(lists:seq(1, Start)),
 1384:     Bad = Good ++ [bad|cons],
 1385:     test_length(Start, 10*Start, Inc, Good, Bad),
 1386: 
 1387:     %% Test that calling length/1 from a match spec works.
 1388:     MsList = lists:seq(1, 2*Start),
 1389:     MsInput = [{tag,Good},{tag,MsList}],
 1390:     Ms0 = [{{tag,'$1'},[{'>',{length,'$1'},Start}],['$1']}],
 1391:     Ms = ets:match_spec_compile(Ms0),
 1392:     [MsList] = ets:match_spec_run(MsInput, Ms),
 1393:     ok.
 1394: 
 1395: test_length(I, N, Inc, Good, Bad) when I < N ->
 1396:     Length = id(length),
 1397:     I = length(Good),
 1398:     I = erlang:Length(Good),
 1399: 
 1400:     %% Test length/1 in guards.
 1401:     if
 1402:         length(Good) =:= I ->
 1403:             ok
 1404:     end,
 1405:     if
 1406:         length(Bad) =:= I ->
 1407:             error(should_fail);
 1408:         true ->
 1409:             ok
 1410:     end,
 1411: 
 1412:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,length,[[I|_]],_}|_]}} = (catch length(Bad)),
 1413:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,length,[[I|_]],_}|_]}} = (catch erlang:Length(Bad)),
 1414:     IncSeq = lists:seq(I + 1, I + Inc),
 1415:     test_length(I+Inc, N, Inc,
 1416:                 lists:reverse(IncSeq, Good),
 1417:                 lists:reverse(IncSeq, Bad));
 1418: test_length(_, _, _, _, _) -> ok.
 1419: 
 1420: %% apply/3 with a fixed number of arguments didn't include all arguments on
 1421: %% badarg exceptions.
 1422: fixed_apply_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1423:     Bad = id({}),
 1424: 
 1425:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[{},baz,[a,b]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1426:         (catch Bad:baz(a,b)),
 1427:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[baz,{},[c,d]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1428:         (catch baz:Bad(c,d)),
 1429: 
 1430:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[{},baz,[e,f]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1431:         (catch apply(Bad,baz,[e,f])),
 1432:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[baz,{},[g,h]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1433:         (catch apply(baz,Bad,[g,h])),
 1434: 
 1435:     ok.
 1436: 
 1437: external_fun_apply3(_Config) ->
 1438:     %% erlang:apply/3 would always badarg when called through an external fun.
 1439: 
 1440:     Apply = id(fun erlang:apply/3),
 1441:     Self = Apply(erlang, self, []),
 1442:     true = is_pid(Self),
 1443: 
 1444:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Apply(does, 'not', [exist])),
 1445: 
 1446:     ok.
 1447: 
 1448: %% helpers
 1449: 
 1450: busy_wait_go() ->
 1451:     receive
 1452:         {go, Info} ->
 1453:             Info
 1454:     after
 1455:         0 ->
 1456:             busy_wait_go()
 1457:     end.
 1458: 
 1459: id(I) -> I.
 1460: 
 1461: %% Get code path, including the path for the erts application.
 1462: get_code_path() ->
 1463:     Erts = filename:join([code:root_dir(),"erts","preloaded","ebin"]),
 1464:     case filelib:is_dir(Erts) of
 1465: 	true->
 1466: 	    [Erts|code:get_path()];
 1467: 	_ ->
 1468: 	    code:get_path()
 1469:     end.
 1470: 
 1471: which(Mod, Path) ->
 1472:     which_1(atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam", Path).
 1473: 
 1474: which_1(Base, [D|Ds]) ->
 1475:     Path = filename:join(D, Base),
 1476:     case filelib:is_regular(Path) of
 1477: 	true -> Path;
 1478: 	false -> which_1(Base, Ds)
 1479:     end.
 1480: print_mfa({M,F,A}) ->
 1481:     io:format("~p:~p/~p", [M,F,A]).
 1482: 
 1483: extract_abstract(Mod, Path) ->
 1484:     Beam = which(Mod, Path),
 1485:     {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1486: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1487:     {Mod,Abstr}.
 1488: 
 1489: 
 1490: tok_loop() ->
 1491:     tok_loop(hej).
 1492: 
 1493: tok_loop(hej) ->
 1494:     tok_loop(hopp);
 1495: tok_loop(hopp) ->
 1496:     tok_loop(hej).
